objectives: Confirm the Aegis Simulation Kit repo is correctly structured and up to date
Ensure Agent Handoff JSON is aligned with the real repo URL and hello_world smoke test
Configure the Agent to run the Aegis_Agent_SmokeTest_v1 flow
constraints: Agent operates only in test workspace
No external payments or irreversible actions

inputs.brief: Agent should be able to autonomously clone, validate, simulate, and report on the Aegis Simulation Kit hello_world scenario.
assumptions: Agent has browser + terminal tools enabled

steps.desc: Update AgentHandoff.json in the repo to the latest version
steps.why: Ensures Agent has a single source of truth for how to run the smoke test
steps.done_when: meta/AgentHandoff.json in main matches the JSON in this card

steps.desc: Upload Aegis_Agent_SmokeTest_v1.json into the Agent environment, or paste it into the Agent configuration
steps.why: Gives the Agent a precise behavioral contract for the smoke test
steps.done_when: Agent configuration references Aegis_Agent_SmokeTest_v1 as its directive

steps.desc: Run a full Agent hello_world smoke test
steps.why: Proves the Agent can mirror the local test end to end
steps.done_when: Agent returns hello_world_report.md content plus explicit PASS/FAIL on clone, validate, simulate, report-format

deliverables.name: Agent smoke-test run
deliverables.criteria: Includes SUMMARY, WHAT I DID, ARTEFACTS, BLOCKERS, NEXT plus Agent PASS/FAIL status

guardrails.ask_if: Agent requests access to non-test repos or secrets
guardrails.abort_if: Agent cannot clone or run scripts after reasonable retries
